problems.title: Square of a Number
problems.description:
Write a function `multiply(int n)` that returns the square of n.

Input: 5
Output: 25
problems.explanation: Define a function that takes an integer parameter and returns its value multiplied by itself.

problems.title: Max of Two
problems.description: Create a function `getMax(int a, int b)` that returns the larger of two numbers.
problems.explanation: Use a simple if-else condition inside the function to compare the two arguments.

starter_codes.python:
def get_max(a, b):
    return a if a > b else b

a, b = map(int, input().split())
print(get_max(a, b))

problems.title: Power Function
problems.description: Write a function `power(base, exp)` that returns base raised to exp.

starter_codes.python:
def power(base, exp):
    return base ** exp

a, b = map(int, input().split())

problems.title: Palindrome Function
problems.description: Write `isPalindrome(n)` returning 1 if n is palindrome, 0 otherwise.

starter_codes.python:
def is_palindrome(n):
    s = str(n)
    return 1 if s == s[::-1] else 0

print(is_palindrome(int(input())))

problems.description: Write `countFactors(n)` returning the number of factors of n.

problems.title: Print Range
problems.description: Write `printRange(a, b)` to print numbers from a to b inclusive, separated by space.

starter_codes.python:
def print_range(a, b):
    print(*range(a, b + 1))

a, b = map(int, input().split())
print_range(a, b)

problems.title: Swap Function
problems.description: Write `swap(&a, &b)` to swap two numbers. (In Python, just print swapped values).

starter_codes.python:
def swap(a, b):
    return b, a

a, b = map(int, input().split())
a, b = swap(a, b)
print(f"{a} {b}")

problems.title: Count Even Function
problems.description: Write `countEven(arr, n)` to return count of even numbers in array.

starter_codes.python:
def count_even(arr):
    c = 0
    for x in arr:
        if x % 2 == 0: c += 1
    return c

n = int(input())
arr = list(map(int, input().split()))
print(count_even(arr))

problems.title: Reverse Array Function
problems.description: Write `printRevArr(arr, n)` to print array in reverse.

starter_codes.python:
def print_rev_arr(arr):
    print(*arr[::-1])

n = int(input())
arr = list(map(int, input().split()))
print_rev_arr(arr)

problems.title: Sort Array Function
problems.description: Write `sortArray(arr, n)` to sort array in ascending order.

starter_codes.python:
def sort_array(arr):
    arr.sort()
    print(*arr)

n = int(input())
arr = list(map(int, input().split()))
sort_array(arr)

problems.title: Matrix Input/Output
problems.description: Write a function to read and print a 2x2 matrix.

problems.title: Sum of Two Matrices
problems.description: Function to sum two 2x2 matrices.

starter_codes.python:
def add_matrix(a, b):
    for i in range(2):
        row = [x + y for x, y in zip(a[i], b[i])]
        print(*row)

a = [list(map(int, input().split())) for _ in range(2)]
b = [list(map(int, input().split())) for _ in range(2)]
add_matrix(a, b)

problems.title: Flatten Array

problems.title: Check Armstrong Function
problems.description: Write `isArmstrong(n)` returning 1 if armstrong, 0 otherwise.

starter_codes.python:
def is_armstrong(n):
    s = str(n)
    p = len(s)
    return 1 if sum(int(d)**p for d in s) == n else 0

print(is_armstrong(int(input())))
